SK.Characteristics: a single control which actuates a single switch.
SK.Morse Composition: a human makes the dits and dahs and builds characters

SS.Characteristics: a single control which actuates a SPDT (single poll, double throw) switch.
SS.Morse Composition: a human makes the dits and dahs and builds characters
SS.Examples: W1SFR Green Machine Torsion Bar Cootie

BUG.Characteristics: a control which actuates a switch as well as a control which actuates a spring and pendulum mechanism which actuates a switch. Both switches are wired in parallel.
BUG.Morse Composition: a machine makes the dits and a human makes the dahs and builds characters.

FAB.Characteristics: a control which actuates one of two separate spring and pendulum mechanisms at a time, each of which actuates a switch. Both switches are wired in parallel.
FAB.Morse Composition: a machine makes the dits and the dahs and a human builds characters.

SP.Characteristics: a single control which actuates two independent switches.
SP.Morse Composition: a machine makes the dits and the dahs and a human builds the characters.

DP.Characteristics: two controls which actuate independent switches.
DP.Morse Composition: a machine makes the dits and the dahs and a human builds the characters.
DP.Examples: Begali Sculpture, VK3IL pressure paddles, M0UKD capacitive touch paddles

CPU.Characteristics: an electronic device performs the actuation of the switch.
CPU.Morse Composition: a machine makes the dits and dahs to build the characters.
